column4: Hi there guys. I want a program (xterm / gnome-terminal) to run upon login into x. is  it enought to put the according command "gnome-terminal" into the .bashrc ?
try gnome-terinal -e "your command"
dnt know if it is working with bashrc
gnome
sudo apt-get install gnome
even when i just want to install "gnome" there is a load of stuff included which i really dont want!! why would they put "gimp" into the gnome-package for gods sake?!?!!?
i dont knw what is in the paket gnome
too much
worked better then in jaunty
concerning the problem with the 959 or whatever it is called?
correct
of course not
you have a ubuntu-support question?
my question is whether bash_completion is worth it
of course
sudo apt-get install apa  tab = apache == bash_completion
see, i never use that
cd /bo  tab = /boot
but zsh is much much better then bash (from the point of using tab)
does it also have a fancy completion script like bash or is it builtin for the most part?
i just got to know bash well enough to work efficiently with it, i wouldnt touch zsh for the next time ;)
most is build in  for e.g. ssh tab is showing you the options, parameters,users and hosts
zsh of course
use it, then you know why i am saying "of course"
understood
apt-cache search sokoban
i didnt find it in aptitude
i found 10 examples using apt-cache search sokoban
try them, there is no best
but the correct answer :) just try them and see what you like most
packages normally dont use ./configure  you can see the default in debian/rules
have a look how a package is created
yes
the packages are already build
thats what im saying
I want to know what ./configure parms i have to compile a source with so it ends up like the bins from the repos
at buildprocess debian/rules is executed, there you can do what you want
do you understand me now?
then have a look at such a package in debian/rules and maybe debian/control (architecutr)
is that not possible?
for what?
#ubuntu+1
right click on it, remove from panel
you can unzip it
/etc/rcS.d/ ?
the place with init-scripts which are executed at (S)tartup, so its rcS
you want to flame?
for compatibility, rcS.d is holding the (S)tart scripts
what compatibility?
to packages like apache and so on
so you dont have to patch all packages because the go into different run-level-directorys
also its part of LSB
#ubuntu-devel
google says that matlab 2011b is working with ubuntu 11.10
I'm pretty sure this does not consider the gcc version.
and why you want to built it and not use a binary?
build what?
why you need gcc if you dont want to built it?
gcc is a compiler-collection
Matlab uses gcc in several parts such as Simulink to compile it's own language.
ah ok
and you get errors when using gcc higher then 4.3?
Yes. Matlab refuses to compile then.
the matlab-site is telling its working with ubuntu 11.04 and gcc-4.5
can you try a normal ubuntu-installation?
live-cd should be fine
Where did you read it supported 4.5?
the site tells ubuntu 11.04 is supported, correct?
yes
By your definition then, that site is wrong then.
I already tried on oneiric
have you used a default 11.04 installation?
No, I can try from the liveCD, give me a few minutes
great
It does not work.
i guess you should contact matlab about that issue
because they said its working with that ubuntu-version
As I already said: Their definition of "working" simply differs from yours. On a sidenote: I"ve been sayiny that all along, and you wouldn't believe me
as i said, contact them, i am no matlab-maintainer
i told you 10 times that they say ubuntu 11.04 is supported and 11.04 comes with gcc higher then 4.3
so lets stop the discussion here, its useless, talk to matlab and ask them about the issue because its not a ubuntu-issue
whatever
lucid have gcc-4.3

Looks like there is a chance that I was wrong - at least with that gcc-4.3 is a requirement. The alleged ERROR is just a WARNING and the subsequent failure does not necessarily have to come from the version mismatch.
nice to see that you post that
not everyone is saying he was wrong
i guess jabber has something about that
if you mean something like teamspeak, skype and so on
Something like sype, just better supported.
